name: Humanist Data Craft
philosophy: Data represents REAL people and phenomena—never lose sight of the human stories within. Imperfection and hand-crafted feel communicate authenticity and care. Complex is not complicated: embrace visual richness that rewards patient exploration. Surface personal and emotional dimensions of data. Each data point has a story worth honoring. Visual complexity that reveals itself through exploration. Beauty as a form of respect for the data and its subjects. Context and narrative as primary concerns. Data as intimate diary rather than clinical record.
layout_principles: Hand-drawn aesthetic even in digital form
Each element can be unique—no strict template
Works as art piece on the wall
annotation_style: Narrative and personal. Write as if telling a story. Annotations can be longer, more contemplative. Hand-lettered aesthetic even if typeset. Legend as a beautiful decoded key, placed thoughtfully. Encourage exploration: 'if you look closely...' Connect data to human experience in annotations. Poetic register is acceptable.
gemini_modifiers:
STYLE INSTRUCTIONS (Humanist Data Craft):
- Create a visualization that feels HUMAN and CRAFTED
- Warm, organic color palette: cream background (#faf7f2), deep reds, forest greens, gold accents
- Hand-drawn aesthetic—not rigid or mechanical
- Organic, flowing layouts—radial, circular, or freeform
- Each element can have unique character
- Typography: elegant serifs (Garamond, Didot style)
- Think of this as DATA ART—beautiful enough to hang on a wall
- Legend/key as a beautiful design element, not just utilitarian
- Embrace complexity—layers reward exploration
- Annotations can be narrative, even poetic
- Small details for those who look closely
- NO stark, corporate, or mechanical feel
- Warm and inviting, not cold and clinical

influences.tradition_note: This approach draws from the Data Humanism movement, which advocates for visualization that honors the human stories within data. It connects to broader traditions in information design, data art, and participatory data practices that emphasize craft, intimacy, and emotional resonance.

exemplars.name: Giorgia Lupi
exemplars.contribution: Articulated the Data Humanism philosophy and demonstrated hand-crafted data visualization

exemplars.name: Stefanie Posavec
exemplars.contribution: Pioneered intimate, personal data visualization through the Dear Data project

exemplars.name: Nicholas Felton
exemplars.contribution: Annual reports as personal data art, demonstrating quantified self as aesthetic practice
